string.text: What, you feelin' like crap?
Help me out, man! I swear on my life, you won't regret it!
Lookin' at you makes me sick! If you kick the bucket, it's good riddance!
Keep your promises to yourself. Here, take the medkit! [cite: 21]
I owe you big time! I'll tell the broskis you ain't no bullshitter! You'll get respect from the boss and from the rest of the deck too. Our Borov, he lives by the code...
Borov? He's exactly who I need, got sumthin' to shoot the breeze with him 'bout.
You... hey, what's your name again? Don't rush it, I'll give a shout kada it's okay. The big-shot don't like havin' his brain scrambled for nothin'... Mongol's my name, if you need sumthin'.
They call me the Marked One. Well, get goin', I'll be waitin'.
Thanks, brother! You helped save my partner! Here, take this, it's from the heart. And write down this recipe; it'll come in handy.
How did this happen? Why did the bandits capture your friend?

Damn it... we have some miserable leaders! They send you out without asking anyone... Ivantsov, we have one like that, decided to show some initiative. We caught a bandit at Agroprom. Seemed like he was an assistant to Borov, the boss around here. Well, Ivantsov sent a group to verify the information we got from that guy, Kocherga. But... I don't know the details of what and how. The thugs just snatched the whole group right at the entrance to the Valley. I was at Agroprom on another matter at the time. As soon as I heard our guys were missing, I came straight here...
I see. So you're saying Borov runs things here?

Yes, him. We just can't seem to get it together to clean out his viper's nest. The creatures have dug themselves in deep. Ivantsov keeps promising to send a reinforced group. There are a lot of them, these lowlives. I think we need to get the regular stalkers to rise up for this. They suffer the most from this scum. I heard those idiots got a real beating over at the Garbage?
Yeah, there was some shooting there, I think, but I didn't look into it.
That was Bes and his crew. Well, and I participated too. We gave it to them as hard as it gets at the vehicle graveyard.
Well... there was some shooting there, yeah. It seems Bes died then, or maybe I'm confused and it happened later... I have some memory problems; don't look at me like I'm crazy.
I'm telling you for sure, someone shredded those thugs! I'm going there now to talk to the guys at our outpost. Prapor is a solid man. Maybe we'll figure something out...

Really? So you know Bes? I've received some information here. Well, you heard that brat screaming yourself.
*Cough*
I don't know... I feel like you can be relied upon.
Anyway, look—that thug said that not far from here, in the ravine behind the gas station, some dogs tore apart a pack horse that fell behind a weapons caravan. Supposedly, it had a couple of crates of ammunition on it. Those weaklings won't go there themselves—they're too scared. And Bes has been saying for a long time that if he had more ammo, he'd organize his men and they'd clear this place out...
Really? That's a shame about the guy. He was a tough nut. Well, take care. And thanks again.
So, what exactly are you proposing?

If you have the time, head down to that ravine and check it out. If there really are any cartridges there, take them to Bes. He's a tough man; I'm sure he'll find a way to put them to their intended use.
Alright, I'll take a look if I get the chance.
Damn, friend... my old friend, what do I do now? Thanks, brother. At least you tried to help. I'm a man of my word, regardless.
Forgive me! My hand slipped, I couldn't take the bandit out in time. How did this happen? Why did they take your friend in the first place?

Dammit... we have some pathetic commanders! They send people out without consulting anyone... Ivantsov, one of our leaders, decided to show some initiative. We captured a bandit at Agroprom—supposedly an associate of Borov, the boss here. Ivantsov sent a team to check the intel we got from that Kocherga guy. But... I don't know the specifics. The thugs snatched the whole team right at the entrance to the Valley. I was at Agroprom on other business. As soon as I heard our guys were gone, I rushed here...
I see. So Borov is the one running the show here?
Yes, him. Sorry... I can't talk right now... Go your own way, stalker.
I understand. Sorry again.
Why are you lingering here? You'll get shot by accident. You should join us! Duty always needs good fighters with clean hands and cool heads.
I'm doing alright on my own for now.
Suit yourself. If you change your mind, let me know. I'll give my guys a heads-up about you.
You refused to help when I asked. Get out of here, we have nothing to talk about.
If we have nothing to talk about, then so be it.
Hey, friend! I'm a Duty scout. Help me get out of here, or at least let our guys know that I've been taken prisoner by bandits!
Alright, I'll try to think of something.
Sorry, I can't help you with anything.
Hello, stalker! Did you manage to contact anyone from Duty? Maybe you have some ideas on how to get me out?
I've notified your people, just wait. I think they should be letting you go soon.
Haven't had the time yet, wait.
What was that shooting upstairs? Maybe you could let me out while they're in a panic? You need to press that button on the wall to unlock the door.
Borov suffered a severe overdose of lead, so it's high time for you to clear out.
I don't think that's a good idea. The building is full of bandits.
Thanks for the help, buddy! I'll make it out quietly from here on my own. We'll meet up later at our checkpoint at the Garbage; I'll reward you then.
Well, suit yourself.
Oh, hello! I'm glad they got you out of Borov's dungeons.
You're not as glad as I am! A huge thank you to you, friend! I found a simple little artifact on my way out of the Valley; please accept it from the bottom of my heart.
Much appreciated. Well, take care!
Friend, give me a medkit!
Here you go.
Sorry, I don't have a medkit.
Thanks, friend! You saved me, I'm speechless. If we stay alive and meet again, I'll try to pay my debt. How should I address you?
I'm tired of explaining it to everyone. I am the Marked One.

It's good that there are people like you, Marked One. My name is Vlad. Please excuse the fact that I can't thank you with something right away; I'm generally still a rookie in the Zone. I'm looking for a certain miraculous artifact; I need it very badly.
Miraculous? Hmph... I don't really believe in miracles.

I don't have any other choice... It's the last hope for helping my daughter get well! Besides, look here, one of the Duty members at the checkpoint shared a recipe with me. Have you heard of the "Slimy Porcupine"?
No. Sounds like a peculiar beast...

Oh no, it's a modified artifact! Let me copy down how to get it for you. It got its name because the whole thing oozes some kind of smelly gunk, so abundantly that you'd better not wear it on your belt or else you'll never be able to wash your pants! At least, that's how the Duty soldier explained it to me.\nThis Porcupine stops bleeding, provides extra energy, and protects against electric shock! And you say there are no miracles... It's just a shame that in my case, even this isn't enough.
Forgive me, Marked One, I must go.
Listen, Vlad, is Oksana your wife by any chance?
Oksana? Yes... but how do you know?
I met her at the Swamps and helped her reach the Cordon. She's looking for you...
I met her at the Swamps. She's looking for you.
I saw her briefly at the Swamps. Only... I heard that she died. I'm sorry.
To the Cordon? Right, I... please excuse me, I'm heading there now.
At the Swamps? Right, I... please excuse me, I'm heading there now.
Dead? I don't believe it! I would have felt it! And what about Masha? At the Swamps? Where exactly, do you know? I... I'm heading there.
Alright, get going, get going.
